bcl:section.bcl:text: Except in the circumstances set out in section 8 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act, no person shall allow

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: stallions over one year old, or
swine

bcl:section.bcl:text: to be at large in a livestock district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of meeting to establish a bull control area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any 5 graziers in a livestock district who reside within an area which they desire to have established as a bull control area may, by notice in accordance with subsection (2), call a meeting of graziers resident within that area, which meeting shall be at a time and place named in the notice.
The notice shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contain a description of the proposed bull control area,
be given by posting a copy

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: at each post office serving the area, or
at any 2 conspicuous public places in the area

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at least 15 days before the date named for the meeting, and
be published in at least one issue of a newspaper circulating in the area not less than 15 days before the meeting.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where a meeting is called under section 2, every grazier resident in the area involved may attend and take part in the discussion at the meeting.
A majority of the graziers present at the meeting may decide to present a petition for the establishment of a bull control area.
Following a decision under subsection (2), the graziers present at the meeting shall elect 2 of their own number for appointment to the bull control committee.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The petition for the constitution of a bull control area shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be addressed to the director,
include a description of the proposed bull control area,
state the names and addresses of the 2 persons whom the petitioners have elected under section 3 (3),
be signed by those graziers who voted affirmatively under section 3 (2), and
contain the address of each grazier who signs.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Establishment of the bull control area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receiving the petition, accompanied by proof

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: of compliance with sections 2 and 3, and
that the petition is signed by not less than 60% of the graziers resident in the proposed bull control area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director may by order constitute the area described in the petition as a bull control area under such name as the director considers advisable.
The director may revoke an order under subsection (1) or disestablish a bull control area continued under section 20 (1)1 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bull control committee fails to comply with the Act or this regulation, or
60% of the graziers resident in the area so request.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Members of the bull control committee
bcl:section.bcl:text: A bull control committee shall be composed of 3 members, of which

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 2 shall be elected by the graziers, and
one shall be appointed by the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Term of office of the first members
bcl:section.bcl:text: The first members of a bull control area elected by the graziers shall hold office,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of the member receiving the lesser number of votes at the meeting held under section 3, for a term ending with the first annual meeting after the constitution of the bull control area, and
in the case of the other member, for a term ending with the second annual meeting after the constitution of the bull control area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The election and appointment of the first members of a bull control committee shall be included in the order constituting the bull control area.
Subject to sections 7 and 10, every member shall hold office from the time of the member's appointment until the second annual meeting after the member's appointment.
Notice of members elected and appointed must be filed in the office of the director.
In the event of any casual vacancy in the membership of the committee, the remaining members of the committee shall constitute the committee until the vacancy is filled.

If any member of the committee is absent from the province for 3 months or fails to attend to the member's duties for a like period the other members of the committee may declare the member's office vacant.
Any member of the committee shall cease to hold office if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the member is convicted of any offence under the Act or regulations,
the member resigns the member's office by notice in writing to the committee, or
the member's office is declared vacant under subsection (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If any vacancy occurs in the membership of the committee by reason of the death of a member or through any member ceasing to hold office, the remaining members of the committee may, subject to the approval of the director, fill the vacancy.
The person appointed to fill the vacancy shall hold office for the unexpired term of the member whose office the person fills.

If more candidates are nominated by graziers than are required to fill the vacancies, the chair of the meeting shall, with the consent of the majority, proceed to take the votes of the graziers by secret ballot.
In the event of a tied vote, the chair shall conduct a second vote on the candidates who are tied.
If a second tie occurs, the chair of the meeting has a casting vote.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The committee shall prepare, maintain and revise a Register of Graziers in which shall be kept the names and addresses of all graziers resident in the bull control area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The bull control committee shall appoint from among their members

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a chair, who shall have a casting vote, and
a secretary-treasurer, who shall carry out the ordinary duties of those offices.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The secretary-treasurer, on the requisition of a member, shall summon a meeting of the committee.
An order or resolution signed by all the members of the committee is valid and effective without meeting.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The bull control committee shall deal with complaints from owners or occupiers of land within the bull control area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The bull control committee shall bring any irregularity observed in regard to the control of a bull running at large within the bull control area to the attention of the owner of the bull.
Upon receipt of notice of the irregularity the owner of the bull shall correct it, or stop the bull running at large.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The bull control committee shall, before the 28th day of February of each year, review the records of all bulls running at large in the bull control area during the previous calendar year and make orders upon graziers as to which bulls must be removed and what additional bulls must be secured for turning out in the bull control area.
Where requested by the bull control committee, a grazier shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: furnish the committee with any information required by the committee, including an accurate account of all breeding females and a full history of the grazier's herd sires, and
promptly present the grazier's bulls and breeding cattle for inspection and examination by the committee, or the authorized representative of the committee.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The bull control committee may, and shall if ordered by the director, call a special general meeting of graziers resident within the bull control area.
No person is entitled to take part in the proceedings of a general meeting of graziers, other than the meeting referred to in section 3, unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's name is entered in the register of graziers, or
the person satisfies the chair of the general meeting that the person is a grazier resident in the bull control area.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The bull control committee shall, between October 1 in a year and January 31 in the succeeding year, call a meeting of graziers in the bull control area for the purpose of electing a candidate to fill a vacancy in the membership of the committee, reviewing accounts and for the transaction of other business.
The bull control committee shall give every grazier whose name is entered in the register of graziers 14 days notice of the date, time and place of every general meeting by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: mailing it to every registered grazier at the grazier's last known address, and
publishing it in one issue of a newspaper circulating in the bull control area.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The graziers present at a general meeting shall elect a chair to conduct the business of the meeting according to established practice.

In the event of a delay or irregularity occurring in the conduct of a general meeting, or of doubt arising as to the validity of the election of a member of the bull control committee, the matter shall be referred to the director for determination, and the director's decision is final.
The secretary-treasurer shall promptly transmit to the director a copy of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minutes of every meeting of the bull control committee,
every order or determination made by the committee,
the annual accounts of the committee, and
the minutes of every general meeting of graziers, certified by the chair of the general meeting.
